## Description {#details}

This file implements a CFG stacking pass.

This pass inserts BLOCK, LOOP, TRY, and TRY&#95;TABLE markers to mark the start of scopes, since scope boundaries serve as the labels for <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/webassembly">WebAssembly</a>&#39;s control transfers.

This is sufficient to convert arbitrary CFGs into a form that works on <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/webassembly">WebAssembly</a>, provided that all loops are single-entry.

In case we use exceptions, this pass also fixes mismatches in unwind destinations created during transforming CFG into wasm structured format.

<SectionDefinition>

### explicitlyBranchesTo() {#a1813fce5c5ee30f9103a9a5abeb7cee6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static bool explicitlyBranchesTo (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42; Pred, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42; MBB)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Test whether Pred has any terminators explicitly branching to MBB, as opposed to falling through.

Note that it&#39;s possible (eg. in unoptimized code) for a branch instruction to both branch to a block and fallthrough to it, so we check the actual branch operands to see if there are any explicit mentions.

Definition at line <a href="#l00194">194</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/webassembly/webassemblycfgstackify-cpp">WebAssemblyCFGStackify.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Before running rewriteDepthImmediates function, &#39;delegate&#39; has a BB as its</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// destination operand. getFakeCallerBlock() returns a fake BB that will be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// used for the operand when &#39;delegate&#39; needs to rethrow to the caller. This</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00617" /><CodeLine lineNumber="617"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Local expression tree should go after the TRY.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00618" /><CodeLine lineNumber="618"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For BLOCK placement, we start the search from the previous instruction of a</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00658" /><CodeLine lineNumber="658"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the END&#95;TRY marker should go after that. Otherwise, the whole try-catch</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00660" /><CodeLine lineNumber="660"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>.getOpcode() == WebAssembly::END&#95;LOOP) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00661" /><CodeLine lineNumber="661"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For a LOOP to be after TRY, LOOP&#39;s BB should be after TRY&#39;s BB; if they</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00782" /><CodeLine lineNumber="782"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00783" /><CodeLine lineNumber="783"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If Header unwinds to MBB (= Header contains &#39;invoke&#39;), the try&#95;table block</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00784" /><CodeLine lineNumber="784"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// should contain the call within it. So the call should go after the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00785" /><CodeLine lineNumber="785"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// TRY&#95;TABLE. The exception is when the header&#39;s terminator is a rethrow</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00787" /><CodeLine lineNumber="787"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// it, is gonna throw.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00788" /><CodeLine lineNumber="788"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &#42;ThrowingCall = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00809" /><CodeLine lineNumber="809"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00810" /><CodeLine lineNumber="810"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Local expression tree should go after the TRY&#95;TABLE.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00811" /><CodeLine lineNumber="811"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For BLOCK placement, we start the search from the previous instruction of a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00812" /><CodeLine lineNumber="812"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// BB&#39;s terminator, but in TRY&#95;TABLE&#39;s case, we should start from the previous</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00813" /><CodeLine lineNumber="813"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// instruction of a call that can throw, or a EH&#95;LABEL that precedes the call,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00825" /><CodeLine lineNumber="825"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00826" /><CodeLine lineNumber="826"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00827" /><CodeLine lineNumber="827"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Add the TRY&#95;TABLE and a BLOCK for the catch destination. We currently</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00830" /><CodeLine lineNumber="830"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00863" /><CodeLine lineNumber="863"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> WebAssembly::CATCH:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00864" /><CodeLine lineNumber="864"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// CATCH&#39;s destination block&#39;s return type is the extracted value type,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00865" /><CodeLine lineNumber="865"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// which is currently the thrown value&#39;s pointer type for all supported</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00954" /><CodeLine lineNumber="954"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is what can happen if we don&#39;t create the latter mapping:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00955" /><CodeLine lineNumber="955"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00956" /><CodeLine lineNumber="956"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Suppoe in the legacy EH we have this code:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00957" /><CodeLine lineNumber="957"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// try</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00958" /><CodeLine lineNumber="958"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   try</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00959" /><CodeLine lineNumber="959"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     code1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00960" /><CodeLine lineNumber="960"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   catch (a)</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00962" /><CodeLine lineNumber="962"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   code2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00963" /><CodeLine lineNumber="963"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// catch (b)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00964" /><CodeLine lineNumber="964"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// end&#95;try</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00965" /><CodeLine lineNumber="965"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00966" /><CodeLine lineNumber="966"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If we don&#39;t create the latter mapping, try&#95;table markers would be placed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00967" /><CodeLine lineNumber="967"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// like this:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00968" /><CodeLine lineNumber="968"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// try&#95;table</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00969" /><CodeLine lineNumber="969"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   code1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00970" /><CodeLine lineNumber="970"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// end&#95;try&#95;table (a)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00971" /><CodeLine lineNumber="971"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// try&#95;table</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00972" /><CodeLine lineNumber="972"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   code2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00973" /><CodeLine lineNumber="973"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// end&#95;try&#95;table (b)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00974" /><CodeLine lineNumber="974"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00975" /><CodeLine lineNumber="975"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This does not reflect the original structure, and more important problem</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00976" /><CodeLine lineNumber="976"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// is, in case &#39;code1&#39; has an unwind mismatch and should unwind to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00977" /><CodeLine lineNumber="977"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#39;end&#95;try&#95;table (b)&#39; rather than &#39;end&#95;try&#95;table (a)&#39;, we don&#39;t have a way to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00978" /><CodeLine lineNumber="978"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// make it jump after &#39;end&#95;try&#95;table (b)&#39; without creating another block. So</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00979" /><CodeLine lineNumber="979"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// even if we don&#39;t place &#39;end&#95;try&#39; marker at the end of &#39;catch&#39; block</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00980" /><CodeLine lineNumber="980"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// anymore, we create ScopeTops mapping the same way as the legacy exception,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00981" /><CodeLine lineNumber="981"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// so the resulting code will look like:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00982" /><CodeLine lineNumber="982"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// try&#95;table</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00983" /><CodeLine lineNumber="983"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   try&#95;table</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00984" /><CodeLine lineNumber="984"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     code1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00985" /><CodeLine lineNumber="985"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   end&#95;try&#95;table (a)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00986" /><CodeLine lineNumber="986"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   code2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00987" /><CodeLine lineNumber="987"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// end&#95;try&#95;table (b)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00988" /><CodeLine lineNumber="988"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;End : &#123;&amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#a5958512eae2979bd2eb383977996a600">MBB</a>, Cont&#125;)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00989" /><CodeLine lineNumber="989"><span class="doxyHighlight">    updateScopeTops(Header, End);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00990" /><CodeLine lineNumber="990"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00991" /><CodeLine lineNumber="991"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00992" /><CodeLine lineNumber="992"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> WebAssemblyCFGStackify::removeUnnecessaryInstrs(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp;MF) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00993" /><CodeLine lineNumber="993"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/hexagoncopytocombine-cpp/#a1d40004718218dbdf06b496766299101">TII</a> = &#42;MF.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction/#a3825368aca2bc1550d173660df4da6a6">getSubtarget</a>&lt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/webassemblysubtarget">WebAssemblySubtarget</a>&gt;().getInstrInfo();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00994" /><CodeLine lineNumber="994"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00995" /><CodeLine lineNumber="995"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// When there is an unconditional branch right before a catch instruction and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00996" /><CodeLine lineNumber="996"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// it branches to the end of end&#95;try marker, we don&#39;t need the branch, because</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00997" /><CodeLine lineNumber="997"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// if there is no exception, the control flow transfers to that point anyway.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00998" /><CodeLine lineNumber="998"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// bb0:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00999" /><CodeLine lineNumber="999"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   try</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01000" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1000"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01001" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1001"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     br bb2      &lt;- Not necessary</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1002"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// bb1 (ehpad):</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1003"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   catch</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1004"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1005"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// bb2:            &lt;- Continuation BB</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1006"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   end</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1007"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1008"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// A more involved case: When the BB where &#39;end&#39; is located is an another EH</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1009"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// pad, the Cont (= continuation) BB is that EH pad&#39;s &#39;end&#39; BB. For example,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1010"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// bb0:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1011"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   try</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1012"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     try</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1013"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//       ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1014"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//       br bb3      &lt;- Not necessary</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1015"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// bb1 (ehpad):</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1016"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     catch</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1017"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// bb2 (ehpad):</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1018"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     end</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1019"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   catch</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1020"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1021"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// bb3:            &lt;- Continuation BB</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1022"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   end</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1023"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1024"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// When the EH pad at hand is bb1, its matching end&#95;try is in bb2. But it is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1025"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// another EH pad, so bb0&#39;s continuation BB becomes bb3. So &#39;br bb3&#39; in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1026"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// code can be deleted. This is why we run &#39;while&#39; until &#39;Cont&#39; is not an EH</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1027"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// pad.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1028"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#a5958512eae2979bd2eb383977996a600">MBB</a> : MF) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1029"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#a5958512eae2979bd2eb383977996a600">MBB</a>.isEHPad())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1030"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">continue</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1031"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1040"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We started from an EH pad, so the end marker cannot be a delegate</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1041"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(EndTry-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr/#a0363204b5fbab08a46f5a7cd7f376f78">getOpcode</a>() != WebAssembly::DELEGATE);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1043"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1044"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1045"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Analyzable = !<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/hexagoncopytocombine-cpp/#a1d40004718218dbdf06b496766299101">TII</a>.analyzeBranch(&#42;EHPadLayoutPred, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvredundantcopyelimination-cpp/#a1441f79530bc7f3a89118bb8067eac69">TBB</a>, FBB, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvredundantcopyelimination-cpp/#a193847098793cdbab306803186676899">Cond</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1046"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This condition means either</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1047"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 1 This BB ends with a single unconditional branch whose destinaion is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1048"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    Cont.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1049"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 2 This BB ends with a conditional branch followed by an unconditional</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1050"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    branch, and the unconditional branch&#39;s destination is Cont.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1051"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// In both cases, we want to remove the last (= unconditional) branch.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1052"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (Analyzable &amp;&amp; ((<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvredundantcopyelimination-cpp/#a193847098793cdbab306803186676899">Cond</a>.empty() &amp;&amp; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvredundantcopyelimination-cpp/#a1441f79530bc7f3a89118bb8067eac69">TBB</a> &amp;&amp; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvredundantcopyelimination-cpp/#a1441f79530bc7f3a89118bb8067eac69">TBB</a> == Cont) ||</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1064"><span class="doxyHighlight">        &#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1067"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1068"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1069"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1070"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// When there are block / end&#95;block markers that overlap with try / end&#95;try</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1071"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// markers, and the block and try markers&#39; return types are the same, the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1072"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// block /end&#95;block markers are not necessary, because try / end&#95;try markers</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1073"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// also can serve as boundaries for branches.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1074"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// block         &lt;- Not necessary</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1075"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   try</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1076"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1077"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   catch</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1078"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1079"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   end</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1129"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1130"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// In RegStackify, when a register definition is used multiple times,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1131"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    Reg = INST ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1132"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    INST ..., Reg, ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1133"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    INST ..., Reg, ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1134"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    INST ..., Reg, ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1135"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1136"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// we introduce a TEE, which has the following form:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1137"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    DefReg = INST ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1138"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    TeeReg, Reg = TEE&#95;... DefReg</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1139"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    INST ..., TeeReg, ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1140"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    INST ..., Reg, ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1141"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    INST ..., Reg, ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1142"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// with DefReg and TeeReg stackified but Reg not stackified.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1143"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1144"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// But the invariant that TeeReg should be stackified can be violated while we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1145"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// unstackify registers in the split BB above. In this case, we convert TEEs</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1146"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// into two COPYs. This COPY will be eventually eliminated in ExplicitLocals.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1147"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    DefReg = INST ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1148"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    TeeReg = COPY DefReg</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1149"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    Reg = COPY DefReg</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1150"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    INST ..., TeeReg, ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1151"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    INST ..., Reg, ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1152"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    INST ..., Reg, ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1153"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a> : <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a3d2cdc4a0db233678e7141c9d6ea3419">llvm::make&#95;early&#95;inc&#95;range</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#a5958512eae2979bd2eb383977996a600">MBB</a>)) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1154"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/webassembly/#a8fd4c79cd9af314c5d43043e10dcb0db">WebAssembly::isTee</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>.getOpcode()))</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1295"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1296"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Given an unwind destination, return a trampoline BB. A trampoline BB is a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1297"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// destination of a nested try&#95;table inserted to fix an unwind mismatch. It</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1298"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// contains an end&#95;block, which is the target of the try&#95;table, and a throw&#95;ref,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1299"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to rethrow the exception to the right try&#95;table.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1300"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// try&#95;table (catch ... )</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1301"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   block exnref</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1302"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1303"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     try&#95;table (catch&#95;all&#95;ref N)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1304"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//       some code</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1305"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     end&#95;try&#95;table</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1306"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1307"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     unreachable</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1308"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   end&#95;block                      ;; Trampoline BB</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1309"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   throw&#95;ref</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1310"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// end&#95;try&#95;table</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1311"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1312"><span class="doxyHighlight">WebAssemblyCFGStackify::getTrampolineBlock(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42;UnwindDest) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1313"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We need one trampoline BB per unwind destination, even though there are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1314"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// multiple try&#95;tables target the same unwind destination. If we have already</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1315"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// created one for the given UnwindDest, return it.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1316"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> It = UnwindDestToTrampoline.find(UnwindDest);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1317"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (It != UnwindDestToTrampoline.end())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1318"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> It-&gt;second;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01484" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1484"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   end&#95;try&#95;table</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01485" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1485"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// post&#95;bb: (previous &#39;ehpad&#39;)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01486" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1486"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   catch</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01487" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1487"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01488" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1488"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(EndBB-&gt;isEHPad());</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01489" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1489"><span class="doxyHighlight">      PreBB = MF.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction/#adfc62ee16549afaac5bde30156ddc989">CreateMachineBasicBlock</a>();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01490" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1490"><span class="doxyHighlight">      PostBB = EndBB;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01491" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1491"><span class="doxyHighlight">      MF.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction/#af4c0db6d503e0ba3b8e44067023ffbba">insert</a>(PostBB-&gt;getIterator(), PreBB);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1492"><span class="doxyHighlight">      MF.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction/#af4c0db6d503e0ba3b8e44067023ffbba">insert</a>(PostBB-&gt;getIterator(), EndTryTableBB);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01493" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1493"><span class="doxyHighlight">      PreBB-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#adf0023bdc4f05a7849c35b1c859580d8">splice</a>(PreBB-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#acbc921830578e2741be6549db716c0ce">end</a>(), PostBB, PostBB-&gt;begin(), SplitPos);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01494" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1494"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We don&#39;t need to transfer predecessors of the EH pad to &#39;PreBB&#39;,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01495" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1495"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// because an EH pad&#39;s predecessors are all through unwind edges and they</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01496" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1496"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// should still unwind to the EH pad, not PreBB.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01497" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1497"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
